fieldset.name: Pseudo Absences
fieldset.label: Pseudo Absence Configuration
fieldset.description: Select and configure your strategy. Read More ...

field.name: pa_ratio
field.description: ratio of absence to presence points
field.title: absence-presence ratio

field.name: pa_strategy
field.description: strategy to generate pseudo-absence points: random; SRE (in sites with contrasting conditions to presences); disk (within a minimum and maximum distance from presences)
field.title: pseudo-absence strategy

field.name: pa_sre_quant
field.description: quantile used for 'SRE' pseudo-absence generation strategy; default is 0.025
field.title: pseudo-absence SRE quantile

field.name: pa_disk_min
field.description: minimum distance (m) to presences for 'disk' pseudo-absence generation strategy
field.title: pseudo-absence disk minimum distance (m)

field.name: pa_disk_max
field.description: maximum distance (m) to presences for 'disk' pseudo-absence generation strategy
field.title: pseudo-absence disk maximum distance (m)

fieldset.name: Other
fieldset.label: Other Configuration
fieldset.description: Options are set to package defaults unless otherwise modified.

field.name: prevalence
field.description: allows to give more or less weight to particular observations; default = NULL: each observation (presence or absence) has the same weight; if value < 0.5: absences are given more weight; if value > 0.5: presences are given more weight
field.title: weighted response weights

field.name: var_import
field.description: number of permutations to estimate the relative importance of each variable
field.title: resampling

field.name: do_full_models
field.description: calibrate & evaluate models with the whole dataset?
field.title: do full models

field.name: do.classif
field.description: true for a classification, false for a regression forest. Currently ignored in biomod2 source
field.title: do.classif

field.name: ntree
field.description: maximum number of trees to grow; this should not be set to too small a number, to ensure that every input row gets sampled at least a few times
field.title: maximum number of trees

field.name: mtry
field.description: number of variables randomly sampled as candidates at each split; default is the square root of the number of variables in the model
field.title: number of variables at each split (mtry)

field.name: nodesize
field.description: minimum number of observations in terminal nodes; a larger number results in smaller trees, but for best accuracy use default value of 1
field.title: terminal node size

field.name: maxnodes
field.description: maximum number of terminal nodes that each tree in the forest can have; default = NULL, which means that trees are grown to the maximum possible (subject to limits by terminal node size)
field.title: maximum number of terminal nodes
